title: America's unofficial party house where Trump spent the night
content: The ambassador's residence in central London has a colourful history and may be on Trump's itinerary.

title: Inflation remains at 3.8% in August as food costs rise
content: The pace of price rises matched the inflation rate in July and comes as the Bank of England meets to discuss interest rates.

title: Charlie Kirk suspect confessed in hidden note to roommate, prosecutors allege
content: The 22-year-old has been charged with murder and is facing the death penalty if convicted at trial.

title: Madeleine McCann suspect freed from German prison
content: Christian Brückner has never been charged with any crime in relation to the McCann case.

title: Rescuing my poisoned cat cost £3,000 - here's how to spot fake medicine
content: Pet owners are being urged to check all medicines carefully before using them.

title: New £22bn AI deal could rapidly boost UK economy, says Microsoft boss
content: Boss Satya Nadella said it was the biggest investment the firm had made outside of the US.

title: End of the road for manual drivers? More learners opt for automatics in tests
content: The UK's 2030 ban on the sale of new petrol and diesel cars is said to be driving the trend.

title: Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits over social activism row
content: His resignation marks the latest development in a dispute with parent company Unilever.

title: Labour deputy hopeful Powell attacks welfare 'errors'
content: Lucy Powell also hits back at claims she is running to be deputy leader as a "proxy" for Andy Burnham.

title: Eritrean man wins block on removal to France under 'one in, one out' deal
content: Some migrants who arrived in the UK by small boat had been told they would be put on flights to France as early as Tuesday.

title: Four arrests after Trump and Epstein images projected on Windsor Castle
content: Police said four people remain in custody after the "stunt," which coincided with the US president's arrival in the UK.

title: What is the President doing on his visit to the UK?
content: US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania are in the UK for an unprecedented second state visit.

title: Chris Mason: Trump visit puts focus on pageantry after PM's tough fortnight
content: The government will hope for a reprieve from questions about Peter Mandelson, says the BBC's political editor.

title: 'Completely different, yet genuinely get on' - watch BBC correspondents on Starmer and Trump
content: The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason and North America Editor Sarah Smith discuss what's at stake for both sides during the trip.

title: Politicians get rich while we suffer - so I helped bring down our government in 48 hours
content: Gen Z protesters in Nepal tell the BBC of their pride and heartbreak after last week's momentous protests.

title: Read the text messages between Charlie Kirk accused and roommate
content: "You're joking, right????" the roommate responds in one message after the alleged gunman tells him he did it, according to court documents.

title: 'I created a successful business thanks to a disability grant - but cuts will sink it'
content: Many disabled workers face the threat of losing their jobs or businesses because of long waits for government grants.

title: Syria's worst drought in decades pushes millions to the brink
content: The drought has slashed wheat harvests by 40% in a country where nearly 90% of the population already lives in poverty.

title: The Papers: 'The ego has landed' and 'Don in... none out'
content: Donald Trump's arrival in the UK and the blocked removal of a migrant to France lead the papers.

title: 'It took 20 years but I brought my rapist to justice'
content: Dan Cooper describes how serving on a jury prompted him to re-report the attack he suffered in 2004.

title: Robert Redford: An enthralling star with an aura that lit up Hollywood
content: Look back at the life of the actor whose laconic style made him one of Hollywood's brightest stars.

title: Play now
content: Think you can work out where's hotter and colder than you today? Find out by playing our game

title: 'I've sold my flat before the Renters' Rights Bill becomes law'
content: Patricia Ogunfeibo sells one of her properties in south-east London, saying landlords are "scared".

title: 'Forgotten' royal castle uncovered on Scottish island
content: Archaeologists say the fortress was owned by ancestors of Scotland's medieval Lord of the Isles.

title: UK hopes for 0% tariff on steel exports to US dashed
content: An agreement to reduce tariffs on UK steel to zero in short order was welcomed with some fanfare in July.

title: US tennis star sorry for 'offensive' comments on Chinese food
content: She described the turtle and frog dishes as "crazy" and "wild", causing a social media storm.

title: Boy, 15, fatally stabbed on Manchester street named
content: Parents of Mohanad Abdullaahi Goobe pay tribute after he died in the attack in Moss Side on Monday.

title: Parents fight for justice over couple's toxic limoncello deaths
content: Greta Otteson and Arno Quinton died on Boxing Day last year after they were poisoned by methanol.

title: US officers tied us up and pointed guns at us, South Korean engineers tell BBC
content: Korean workers who were detained in the US say they were treated like criminals and are still in shock.

title: BBC News app
content: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza Says UN Commission
content: Israel rejects UN Commission finding that it is committing genocide in Gaza.

title: Americanswers…on 5 Live! Who is Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s suspected killer?
content: Plus, behind the scenes of Trump’s last state visit and what might happen this week?

title: An Arsenal win made from the bench - and inspired by rugby union
content: Mikel Arteta says Arsenal's "finishers" could be "more important" than their starting line-up - a concept taken from rugby union.

title: 'Clean sheet mentality' - pragmatism proving key for Tottenham
content: Tottenham midfielder Lucas Bergvall says the team now has a "clean sheet mentality" as focus switches from swashbuckling football to pragmatism.

title: Mourinho close to succeeding Lage at Benfica
content: Jose Mourinho is close to replacing Bruno Lage as Benfica manager after he was sacked following Tuesday's Champions League defeat against Qarabag.

title: 'Heartbroken isn't the word' - Hatton son's tribute
content: Ricky Hatton's son Campbell pays tribute to his father, saying "heartbroken isn't the word" after the former world boxing champion's death.

title: GB's Anning reaches 400m final
content: Great Britain's Amber Anning runs a season's best time to qualify for the women's 400m final at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.
